result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt: Status conference on November 23, 2022 at 10:30 am.

10:53 a.m.  Defendant waives her right to a preliminary hearing; 6/27/22 inducement.  Defendant is bound over to Circuit Court Branch 3 for trial.
ARRAIGNMENT - 
Information filed. Copy served on defense counsel.
Not guilty plea(s) entered.  Jury calendar.
Offer deadline:  9/2/22, 8:30 a.m.
Further proceedings scheduled for September 2, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Preliminary hearing on July 28, 2022 at 10:30 am.
11:07 a.m.  Non-appearance by defendant for preliminary hearing.  Warrant issued on State's motion.  Cash bail forfeiture ordered.

2:07 p.m.  Atty. Snavely unavailable for hearing today; good cause found to toll time limits.
Preliminary hearing rescheduled to 7/21/22, 10:30 a.m., Br. 3.

Preliminary hearing on June 29, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Initial appearance on June 13, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

BAIL HEARING -
Defendant in custody on bench warrant and appearing by video from the Manitowoc County Jail.  The matter is continued for an initial appearance on 06-13-22 at 1:30 p.m. Br. 3.  The $100.00 cash bail previously furnished is continued, along with all conditions, and the defendant is released from custody.
Bench warrant with service of officer thereon.

records.addlTxt: Adam Snavely, through Public Defender.

Initial appearance is reset to 03-14-22 at 1:30 p.m. to allow public defender time to appoint counsel.   
Minutes.
Initial appearance on February 14, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

2:50 PM Defendant Arabella R. Balzan did not appear, Special appearance by Attorney Nathan Heim on behalf of the defendant, Attorney Angelina Scarpelli appeared in person for State of Wisconsin. 
The defendant fails to appear for today's initial appearance. 
Court authorizes a warrant for the defendant and orders forfeiture of cash bail.
Re:  Felony bail jumping, on 01-11-22.

$100.00 cash bail furnished and defendant is released from custody.   
Notice to Party Furnishing Cash Bail Bond. 
--Kristie L. Krysheski, 649 Green Bay Road, Apt. 11, Denmark, WI  54208.
Order to report to MTPD for photo and prints
Commitment for Failure to Furnish Bail.

BAIL HEARING - 
Defendant in custody and appearing by video from the Manitowoc County Jail.  The State informs the Court that the defendant will be charged with the crime of possess drug paraphernalia, possess fentanyl, obstruct officer and bail jumping.  The matter is continued for initial appearance on 01-18-22 at 2:30 p.m.  Bail is set at $100.00 cash bond with the conditions that defendant is not to possess any controlled substances or drug paraphernalia and defendant must maintain absolute sobriety from alcohol and drugs.  Bail not furnished and defendant is remanded to the custody of the Sheriff.  
Minutes.
